prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 For the sketch, you will create a face with a single loop. The loop will consist of 6 lines. - Line 1: Starting point at 0.0, 0.0164 and ending point at 0.0934, 0.0 - Line 2: Starting point at 0.0934, 0.0 and ending point at 0.75, 0.0 - Line 3: Starting point at 0.75, 0.0 and ending point at 0.75, 0.0056 - Line 4: Starting point at 0.75, 0.0056 and ending point at 0.0934, 0.0056 - Line 5: Starting point at 0.0934, 0.0056 and ending point at 0.001, 0.0219 - Line 6: Starting point at 0.001, 0.0219 and ending point at 0.0, 0.0164 The loop, which contains these lines, is closed. Scale the sketch by 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following parameters: - Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 - Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 Extrude the 2D sketch to generate a 3D model with the following properties: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.469 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 - Operation: This is a new solid body. The length of this part will be 0.469, the width will be 0.75, and the height will be 0.75. With these instructions, a junior CAD designer can generate an accurate CAD model for part 1.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat bottom, a curved top, and a central hole** Construct the coordinate system for part 1 with no rotation and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 1.1 **Create Face 1** 1.1.1 Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. 1.1.2 Constrain the circle to be closed. Draw another circle inside the one just created with the same center point [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.2062. 1.2.2 Constrain the smaller circle to be closed. 1.3 **Create Face 3** Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.2062. 1.3.1 Constrain the circle to be closed. Create a smaller circle inside the one just created with the same center point [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.0211. 1.3.2 Constrain the smaller circle to be closed. **Scaling and Extrusion** 1.4 Scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.75. 1.5 Extrude Face 1 by 0.0281 units along the normal direction. 1.6 Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal direction to 0.0. **Part 2: Construct a funnel-shaped object** Create the coordinate system for part 2 with no rotation and a translation vector of [0.1453, 0.1453, 0.0]. 2.1 **Create Face 1** 2.1.1 Draw a circle with a center at [0.2297, 0.2297] and a radius of 0.2297. 2.1.2 Constrain the circle to be closed. Create another circle inside the one just created with the same center point [0.2297, 0.2297] and a radius of 0.2062. 2.1.3 Constrain the smaller circle to be closed. **Scaling and Extrusion** 2.2 Scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.4594. 2.3 Extrude Face 1 by 0.2812 units along the normal direction. 2.4 Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal direction to 0.0. **Part 3: Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a central hole** Set up the coordinate system for part 3 with no rotation and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 3.1 **Create Face 1** 3.1.1 Draw a circle with a center at [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.375. 3.1.2 Constrain the circle to be closed. Draw a circle inside the one just created with the same center point [0.375, 0.375] and a radius of 0.2297. 3.1.3 Constrain the smaller circle to be closed. **Scaling and Extrusion** 3.2 Scale the entire sketch by a factor of 0.75. 3.3 Extrude Face 1 by 0.0281 units along the normal direction. 3.4 Set the extrusion depth opposite the normal direction to 0.0. Once the parts are created, combine them using the appropriate boolean operation. Join part 1 and part 3 together, followed by joining the resulting object with part 2.</description>

<description>**Part 1: A Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector [0.005, 0.005, 0.0]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. *Face 1 contains 1 loop and 4 lines.* Create line 1 from the start point [0.0, 0.0] to the end point [0.7401, 0.0]. Create line 2 from the start point [0.7401, 0.0] to the end point [0.7401, 0.1243]. Create line 3 from the start point [0.7401, 0.1243] to the end point [0.0, 0.1243]. Create line 4 from the start point [0.0, 0.1243] to the end point [0.0, 0.0]. Close the loop. Scale the sketch by 0.7401. Extrude the sketch in the normal direction by 0.0006 and in the opposite direction by 0.0. **Part 2: A Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom and a Tapered Middle Section** Create a new coordinate system with the euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0006]. Create a new sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. *Face 1 contains 2 loops and 8 lines.* Create line 1 from the start point [0.0, 0.0] to the end point [0.75, 0.0]. Create line 2 from the start point [0.75, 0.0] to the end point [0.75, 0.1342]. Create line 3 from the start point [0.75, 0.1342] to the end point [0.0, 0.1342]. Create line 4 from the start point [0.0, 0.1342] to the end point [0.0, 0.0]. Create line 5 from the start point [0.005, 0.005] to the end point [0.745, 0.005]. Create line 6 from the start point [0.745, 0.005] to the end point [0.745, 0.1292]. Create line 7 from the start point [0.745, 0.1292] to the end point [0.005, 0.1292]. Create line 8 from the start point [0.005, 0.1292] to the end point [0.005, 0.005]. Close the loops. Scale the sketch by 0.75. Extrude the sketch in the normal direction by 0.0621 and in the opposite direction by 0.0. The overall shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The height is 0.0621, the width is 0.75, and the length is 0.75.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Rectangular Hole** Construct a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center, symmetrical with a flat top and bottom. 1. **Create a new coordinate system:** Use the given coordinate system properties from the JSON data: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] 2. **Generate the 2D sketch:** The sketch is composed of two faces, face_1 and face_2. **Face_1:** 1. **Draw line_1:** Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] End Point: [0.376, 0.0] 2. **Draw line_2:** Start Point: [0.376, 0.0] End Point: [0.376, 0.562] 3. **Draw arc_1:** Start Point: [0.376, 0.562] Mid Point: [0.188, 0.75] End Point: [0.0, 0.562] 4. **Draw line_3:** Start Point: [0.0, 0.562] End Point: [0.0, 0.0] Loop_1 of face_1 consists of these four curves (line_1, line_2, arc_1, and line_3) and is closed. **Face_2:** 1. **Draw a circle (circle_1):** Center: [0.188, 0.562] Radius: 0.0754 Loop_2 of face_2 consists of one circle and fulfills the constraint that a loop should be closed. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch:** Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch scale parameter provided in the JSON data (sketch_scale: 0.75) to adjust its size. 4. **Transform 2D sketch into 3D:** Apply a 3D transformation on the scaled 2D sketch: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] degrees (matching the coordinate system's rotation) - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] (matching the coordinate system's traslation) 5. **Extrude the 3D model:** Extrude the 2D sketch according to the extrusion properties provided: - Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0 - Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.1175 The resulting CAD part will be a cylindrical object with a rectangular hole in the center, symmetrical with a flat top and bottom. It is important to note that all given instructions should be well understood and followed closely by the junior CAD designer. The accurate generation of the described CAD model depends on it.</description>
